_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

What the astute agree on as not existing: Form that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable
Feeling that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable
Perception that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable
Choices that are permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable
Consciousness that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable
What the astute agree on as existing [sn: Form that is impermanent, suffering, and perishable
Feeling that is impermanent, suffering, and perishable
Perception that is impermanent, suffering, and perishable
Choices that are impermanent, suffering, and perishable
Consciousness that is impermanent, suffering, and perishable
What the Realized One understands and co: Form is a temporal phenomenon in the world
Feeling is a temporal phenomenon in the world
Perception is a temporal phenomenon in the world
Choices are a temporal phenomenon in the world
Consciousness is a temporal phenomenon in the world
